column2: Opiate update!
Opium craze sweeps China, traders state it’s long journey, but worth the trip.
Ether craze
Popularity of ether frolics on the rise, pundits claim “It’s a gas!”.
Sweet Dreams
First use of general anaesthesia in an operation, surgeon in USA puts patient to sleep for tumour removal.
Code words
World’s first electrical telegraph message sent in USA by Samuel Morse in the USA.
column4: Erste elektr. telegrafische Nachricht der Welt von Samuel Morse in den USA gesendet.

column2: Meatballs: NOT an aphrodisiac?
A new study out suggests that customary Gothic meatballs are not, despite traditions to the contrary, aphrodisiacs. This has aroused much criticism.
Out now!
“Darkend Souls” released in Japan, critics claim it is too difficult.
Woodwind or Brass?
Gold rush!
Gold discovered along the North American Pacific Coast. Masses of prospectors are expected to rush to the area!
'Ill Corw' published
A grim tour-de-force, this Avallonian latest short story is sure to raise the hairs on the back of your neck.
The bountiful female form
(reader discretion is advised) Female waist and hip sizes are apparently at an all-time minimum and maximum respectively. Continued on page 5
Editorial
This liberalism will destroy the western civilisation. Without strong government, people are going to starve and revert to barbarism to survive and feed their children. (see pg. 10)
Our ancestors?
Scientists amazed by "Nieuwemandal man" fossil discovery in the Frankish Rhineland.
Editorial:
It is the assured opinion of this newspaper that animal-fat is the perfect substance for greasing bullet-cartridges. See how we reached this unshakable conclusion inside (see pg 10)
Canals in decline
The once-proud canal system of our nation is seen to be in precipitous decline. What can be done? Continued on page 4
Lincoln assassinated
Abraham Lincoln assassinated in Ford’s theatre by John Wilkes Booth, shot dead at close range.
Lincoln fine
Failed assassination attempt of Abraham Lincoln by John Wilkes Booth, President throws assailant from balcony of Ford’s theatre.
Unsporting
Military Submarine invented, globally agreed to be “unfair” and banned for all time.
Healthcare
Philomela Florentia founds school for nurses in the Ospitale di Saeth Tomos, Llondin.
Elements organised
Demetrius Mendelius invents periodic table, listing all 56 known elements.
Cycle fad spreads
Bicycle craze sweeps western world, Velocipedes are must haves!
Petasus width at an all-time high
It is reported that the width of an average farmer's petasus has risen to an astounding 57 inches in Italy and Macedonia.
Fire-brigade' established
They're new, but they're good.
Football gains popularity
Attendances at association football matches have risen recently, with the spectacle proving especially popular amongst members of the labouring and destitute classes.
Editorial:
Beware the female bicycleatrix. Women astride machines, petticoats fluttering carelessly in the breeze, ankles exposed for all to see, will send men into a deranged frenzy ( pg. 10)
Pompeii and Herculaneum back to light
New methods of excavation return to the world the cities destroyed by Vesuvius in 79 AD.
column4: Neue Ausgrabungsmethoden bringen die 79 AD vom Vesuv zerstörten Städte der Welt zurück.

column2: Editorial:
The backward peoples of the Orient long for our benevolent governance. Much as Iwerddon graciously welcomed Britannian overlordship, the eastern races crave the guiding hand of the Occident (pg. 10)
Literature:
Around the World in 80 days, reviewed for the reader's pleasure and education.
column4: Um die Welt in 80 Tagen, für Lesespaß und Bildung unserer Leser rezensiert.

column2: Corset-related fainting
Is at an all-time high! Yet again our nation’s spas, hospitals and chaise-longues are inundated with victims of corset overtightening.
Airborn Success!
Suebia, an Alpine airship, becomes first powered airship to make a successful round trip.
High-rise Buildings
“Sky-Scrapers” built in America, these massive steel-framed buildings tower over their surroundings.
Mint juleps saved!
Martianus Petrus, in the colonies, invents the ”drinking straw”.
Nothing can go wrong here
Cure for morphine addiction discovered in Missorí : Coca-wine!
Bismarck resign
Bismarck resigns as Chancellor of Germany, ship of state loses her pilot.
Editorial:
This socialism will destroy western civilisation. Why, it will empower the working classes, allowing them to believe they are as good and worthy as the rich. Pish & fipsy! (pg 10)
Should the American government act?
Lynchings of members of the negro race have become commonplace across the heartlands of America. The editorial board of this publication asks: Should the state intervene to stop this practice?
Lift off!
The Aeolus, a steam-powered heavier than air craft, makes a short powered flight near Bordelh.
Successful Flight!
Taglim Glider becomes the first successful manned aircraft in the world, covering flight distances of up to about 80 feet.
Moving Pictures!
The Kinetoscope astounds viewers by displaying moving pictures at the Averalcrotz Institute of Arts and Sciences.
Hurrah! Tis the gay 90s

As a gayer time than now has surely never been and never again will be, the editorial board respectfully suggests that the phrase ‘the gay 90s’ should make its way into the lexicon of our daily discourse.
column4: Eine wildere Zeit als diese hat es noch nie gegeben und wird es wohl nie wieder geben. Wir schlagen daher vor, den Begriff “Die Wilden 90er” ins Lexikon aufzunehmen.

column2: Could man one day soar?
column4: Kann der Mensch eines Tages fliegen?

column2: Across our nation, dreamers are speculating that man could one day take to the heavens using mechanical contraptions.
column4: Landesweit hoffen Träumer, dass der Mensch eines Tages mithilfe mechanischer Geräte den Himmel erobern wird.

column2: Editorial:
If He had wished man to fly, He would have granted us wings - a guest commentary written by the ship magnate and major shareholder of this newspaper Charles O'Ligarch. (see pg. 10)
column4: Wenn Gott wollte, das wir fliegen, hätte er uns Flügel gegeben (mehr auf Seite 10)

column2: Wrong End Foremost
Reputed paleontologist O.C Marsh revealed today that the famed Elasmosaurus assembled by Professor Cope has in fact its head attached to its tail end. The professor was not available for comment.
column4: Angesehener Paläontologe O.C. Marsh enhüllt, dass der von Professor Cope zusammengesetzte Elasmosaurus seinen Kopf am Schwanz befestigt hat. Cope war nicht für einen Kommentar zu erreichen.

column2: Lighter than air
The first zeppelin flight occurs over Brigantine Lake near Constantia.
Disaster!
A powerful hurricane has hit the coast of Tejas, killing around 8,000 people.
Disaster!
In Martinica, Mount Pelée has erupted, destroying the town of Saint-Pierre and killing over 30,000.
Disaster!
Mount Vesuvius has erupted, devastating Naples.
column4: Der Vesuv ist ausgebrochen, Neapel in Schutt und Asche.

column2: Disaster!
An earthquake and tsunami has hit Sicilia, killing over 70,000 people.
column4: Erdbeben und Tsunami treffen Messina unnd Kalabrien in Sizilien, mehr als 70.000 tot.

column2: The Captain of Köpenick
An impostor masquerading as a German military officer managed to fool soldiers in Berlin and steal over 4000 marks due to so-called suspicions of crooked bookkeeping. He gave a receipt.
column4: Hochstapler gibt sich als deutscher Militäroffizier aus, trickst Soldaten in Berlin aus und stiehlt mehr als 4000 Mark wegen angeblich falscher Buchführung. Er gab eine Quittung.

column2: Disaster!
The Titanica, the largest ship ever built, has sunk after striking an iceberg in the North Atlantic during her maiden voyage, over 1,500 people are believed to have perished in the disaster.
Disaster!
North Sea storm hits Francia, flooding the lowlands. 10,000 people believed dead.
Discovery!
Hiram Bingham rediscovers Machu Picchu, a previously unknown Incan city.
column4: Hiram Bingham entdeckt Machu Pichu wieder, eine vormals unbekannte Inka-Stadt.

column2: Smokers rejoice!
Zipper invented by Lord Zipper.
Breakfast is saved
Carolus Strite invents the pop-up bread toaster.
Continental drift' postulated
Alfred Voerman, a prominent Frankish scientist, has put forth the theory that the very continents upon which we stand could be moving about on the Earth's surface.
General relativity
Albért de Puachava has published his theory of general relativity, a sophisticated set of formulae which seeks to explain the relationship between space, time, gravity and a myriad of other forces.
Editorial:
This feminism will destroy western civilisation. Equality of the sexes is a depravity which no civilised people would contemplate. Why, feminism could lead to women drivers (pg. 10)
Free inside:
A 'cross-word puzzle', a whimsical pastime which will nonetheless allow the reader to demonstrate the fortitude of their perspicacity.
column4: Ein 'Kreuzwort-Rätsel', ein netter Zeitvertreib, mit dem unsere Leser ihren Scharfsinn demonstrieren können.

column2: Li Fantaumas' ending controversy
column4: Kontroverse zum Ende von Sherlock Holmes

column2: After a massive fan outcry due to the bittersweet death of the famous criminal genius, author Artorius Cynedd decides to bring him back from the dead, providing clarification and closure.
Flight record
Carl A. Månsson becomes the first person to fly solo across the Atlantic Ocean (May 20–21, 1927), nonstop from Trimontium to Bordelh.
To the stars!
World’s first flight of a liquid-fueled rocket by Rubért Galdhart.
An end to beards?
First electric razor patented by the Missorian manufacturer Pol Casqui.
The future of music
The first selective Jukeboxes introduced by the Automated Musical Instrument Company.
We don't know why
Pole-sitting fad sweeps western world.
Editorial:
This 'television' genuinely will destroy western civilisation. Today, horrendous wooden puppets, tomorrow, horrendous drunken and lascivious twenty-somethings? (see page 10)
column4: Fernseher werden westliche Zivilisation vernichten (mehr auf Seite 10)

column2: Editorial:
This 'jazz' will destroy western civilisation. Never in the history of music has such a corrupting rhythm been heard. The jungle beat has no place in our repressed society (pg. 10)
The jazz craze!
A new fad has awakened the passions of the nation's music-listeners. Frenetic dancing, unchaperoned licentiousness and race-mixing are natural byproducts of this far out and wrong musical form.
column4: Musikliebhaber von neuer Marotte erfasst: Frenetische Tänze, Zuchtlosigkeit und Rassenvermischung sind Nebenprodukte dieser falschen Musikform.

column2: Literary digest: Ulixes

Penned by Haibernaidd author of some repute, Iago Iudocus, 'Ulixes' describes one day in the life of a Dulyn protagonist merely living his life in a normal fashion, struggling... (continued on page 19)
To Aegyptus!
More astounding archaeological discoveries occured today in the Nile region, furthering the international fascination with all things Classical... (continued on page 2)
column4: Weitere erstaunliche, archäologische Entdeckungen in der Nil-Region befeuern Faszination mit dem Orientalischen … (weiter auf Seite 2)

column2: Edifici architecture
A futuristic new artistic archetectural style, known as Edifici, has risen to prominence in the cities of Liyun, Bordelh and Marselha.
Oddball duo cause chaos

Two men, one fat and one thin, have appeared in court accused of mischief-making and general buffoonery. Due to the severity of the crime, which involved the demolition of a house and theft of an ass, prosecuters are expected to seek the death penalty.
Dog bites a child.
Vicious animal attack leaves community in shock, parents concerned with safety of their children demand action.
column4: Brutale Tierattacken schockieren Gemeinde, Eltern fürchten um die Sicherheit ihrer Kinder und fordern Taten.

column2: Global cooling.
Scientists warn another ice age might be starting as recorded temperatures drop from year to year.
column4: Forscher warnen vor neuer Eiszeit, da Temperaturen jährlich fallen.

column2: Missing child found
He was hiding in a barn! The missing child case resolved after extensive search by local volunteers discovers the child hiding in the nearby abandoned building.
column4: Versteckt in einer Scheune! Der Fall eines vermissten Kindes fand gutes Ende, nachdem engagierte Suchmannschaften es in einem nahen, verlassenen Gebäude fanden.

column2: Damsel brutally murdered

The horrifically-mutilated corpse of a damsel was discovered yesterday tied to a train track. The public is advised to be on the lookout for a man with a large moustache, a top hat and a black opera cloak.
column4: Entsetzlich entstellter Körper einer jungen Maid wurde gestern, an Eisenbahnschienen gefesselt, gefunden. Fahndung nach Mann mit Schnauzbart, Zylinder und schwarzem Umhang läuft.

column2: Rabbit emerges from hat
A man, who claimed to possess mystic powers, was seen to produce a rabbit from a top hat yesterday. He is currently being investigated on suspicion of unnatural practises.
column4: Ein Mann mit angeblich mystischen Kräften wurde gestern gesehen, als er einen Hasen aus dem Hut zauberte. Untersuchungen mit Verdacht auf unnatürliche Praktiken im Gange.

column2: A glimpse into the year 2000
A prominent futurologist has granted an insight into the distant year 2000 A.D. Speaking to our futurology correspondent, he said "By 2000 each landed gentleman will own at least 5 hot-air balloons".
'Parvulus' relases new articles!
The political and comedic collective known as 'The Shorty' has released more incendiary articles, interviewing a radical philosopher and penning a sharp satire of the government.
12 Gored!
An enraged gentleman cow gored 5 men and 7 women to death yesterday. The gentleman cow, who had previously been of a gentle nature, was beheaded by a passing chimney-sweep.
column4: Wütender Bulle tötete gestern 5 Männer und 7 Frauen. Das vormals als sanft bekannte Tier wurde von einem vorbeikommendem Schornsteinfeger enthauptet.

column2: Bridge collapse!

Claims the life of a butcher just outside our nation's capital. The bucther, who was a character of some repute in the locality in question, is survived by his brother, a baker, and a son who manufactures and sells candlesticks.
column4: Ein Metzger wurde außerhalb unserer Hauptstadt in den Tod gerissen. Der lokal bekannte Metzger hinterlässt seinen Bruder, einen Bäcker und einen Sohn, der Kerzenhalter herstellt und verkauft.

column2: Balkans quiet
Thracians, Macedonians, Dalmatians, Dacians, Jazygians, Romans, Albanians and Carantanians came together last Sunday to celebrate the great peace in which the Balkan peninsula presently bathes.
Letter to the editor
A reader calls attention to careless ferry pilots putting lives of passengers at risk with their reckless full speed driving and risky manoeuvres.
column4: Ein Leser warnt vor leichtsinnigen Fährenkapitänen, die mit rücksichtsloser Geschwindigkeit und riskanten Manövern das Leben ihrer Passagiere riskieren.

column2: The weather
Probabilities for the next week: Cloudy and rainy, with north and north-east winds and lowering temperatures.
column4: Aussichten für nächste Woche: Wolkig und Regen, mit Winden aus Nord und Nordost und niedrigen Temperaturen.

column2: Tragic city fire
Fire Department blamed for demonstrating a lack of discipline and efficiency allowing fire to spread across multiple blocks leading to the biggest and most tragic city fire to date.
column4: Feuerwache wegen fehlender Disziplin und Effizienz für das Ausbreiten eines Feuers über mehrere Häuser verantwortlich gemacht, das zum größten Brand aller Zeiten in der Stadt führte.

column2: Fishhook robbery!
Police inform us that a robber managed to steal a substantial amount of money from a teller's desk at a local bank using a fishhook and a stick while the teller was being distracted by an accomplice.
column4: Die Polizei berichtet vom Raub eines beachtlichen Geldbetrags in lokaler Bank unter Verwendung eines Angelhakens und Stockes, während Komplize den Kassenbeamten ablenkte.

column2: Let them jump!
If children have to be still it's a torture for them, scientists claim. Rapid movement of body being the correct expression of joy at very young age should be encouraged not frowned upon.
column4: Forscher bezeichnen das Stillsitzen müssen von Kindern Folter. Ausdauernde Bewegung ist wichtig zum Ausdruck von Freude für kleine Kinder und sollte nicht unterdrückt werden.

column2: Wooden pavements
A new describes chemical processes of hardening wood to increase its endurance beyond that of traditional building materials. Should city boards begin paving streets with wooden panels?
column4: Neue Untersuchung enthüllt chemische Prozesse zur Härtung von Holz im Bauwesen. Sollte die Stadt Straßen mit Holz pflastern?

column2: Life without food?
A man claiming he can abstain from food for at least 30 days and retain full physical and mental fitness challenges physicians to subject his abilities to a test.
column4: Ein Mann behauptet, 30 Tage ohne Nahrung bei voller körperlicher und geistiger Stärke überleben zu können, und fordert Forscher heraus, ihn zu testen.

column2: Deadly fever

Two sailors from a brig returning from tropical areas are reported to have died of an unknown fever. They experienced severe chills followed by extreme thirst and delusions until both eventually perished.
column4: Zwei aus den Tropen heimkehrende Seefahrer sind an einem unbekannten Fieber gestorben. Die Symptome reichen von Schüttelfrost über extremen Durst bis hin zu Wahnvorstellungen.

column2: Artificial diamonds
A European chemist claims by the process known only to himself he managed to coat an ordinary crystal with a surface resembling in every respect that of a real diamond.
column4: Europäischer Chemiker behauptet, mit einem nur ihm bekannten Prozess einen normalen Kristall mit Material ummantelt zu haben, der ihn in allen Aspekten zum Diamanten macht.

column2: Letter from God
One of the poor members of our society receiving a charity letter marked as "from God" responded by giving thanks for the money received, but warns the deity against tax levy and post office theft.
column4: Ein armes Mitglied unserer Gesellschaft dankt dem Sender eines Almosenbriefes “von Gott” für erhaltenes Geld, warnt Sender jedoch vor Steuerforderungen und Briefraub.

column2: Medical news
Top European doctors have speculated that smoke from factory stacks could be responsible for the increased level of respiratory problems seen amongst children.
column4: Führende europäische Ärzte verdächtigen Rauch aus Fabrikschloten als Ursache für Zunahme von Atemstörungen unter Kindern.

column2: Vampyre hysteria
Another outbreak of vampyre hysteria has occurred in Romanian lands. Superstitious peasants have taken to daubing their necks with garlic in a bid to ward off the nefarious ghouls.
column4: Ein neuer Fall von Vampir-Hysterie in Rumänien. Abergläubische Passanten schmieren Nacken mit Knoblauch ein, zum Schutz vor bösartigen Ghulen.

column2: Wolves kill four
A pack of wolves raided a town in Siberia last week and killed four of the inhabitants. Armed policemen have been dispatched to the area to hunt down the lupine beasts.
column4: Ein Wolfsrudel überfiel letzte Woche ein Dorf in Sibirien und tötete vier Einwohner. Bewaffnete Polizeikräfte jagen die Bestien.

column2: Horrific puppets
Ghastly puppets have become a generally accepted part of daily life. The latest terrifying abomination to make its presence felt is a smiling wooden boy with a fixed grin, styled “Bimbo”.
column4: Schreckliche Puppen finden mehr Akzeptanz. Neueste Abartigkeit ist ein debil grinsender Holzjunge im Bimbo-Stil.

column2: Drinking contest

The Geatish drunk Ville Welanus bested rivals from Bulgaria and Caledonia in an alcohol-consuming contest in Petropolis last week. He attributed his victory to ‘sheer love of booze’ from his hospital bed.
Oldest man
Respected gentleman Hieronymus Ananias has been named oldest man alive. Ananias, from the Mississippi Delta, politely entreated reporters from this news-paper to remove themselves from his lawn.
BANK ROBBERY!
Local bank in $ANYPROVINCE$ has been invaded by a masked gang of ne'er-do-wells. The police are searching for the criminals and is granting a reward for any information leading to their capture.
column4: Lokale Bank in $ANYPROVINCE$ von maskierter Gang überfallen. Die Fahndung nach den Kriminellen läuft, eine Belohnung für Informationen, die zur Ergreifung führen, wurde ausgesprochen.

column2: Piano Cat on tour
The famous feline pianist known simply as the Piano Cat is scheduled to arrive in $OURCAPITAL$ this week. The cat artist is expected to play a series of classical pieces.
column4: Die als Klavierkatze berühmte Katzenpianistin wird diese Woche in $OURCAPITAL$ ankommen. Sie soll eine Reihe klassischer Stücke spielen.

column2: Special Lectures

The Council of Science of $OURCAPITAL$ is to present a series of special lectures on the origins of civilisation in the Fertile Crescent. Special presentations of pottery shards from Tyre are planned.
column4: Der Wissenschaftsrat von $OURCAPITAL$ wird eine Reihe von Spezial-Vorlesungen zu den Ursprüngen der Zivilisation im Fruchtbaren Halbmond halten. Eine Präsentiation von Tonscherben aus Tyros ist eingeplant.

column2: HEED! HEED!
A storm of gigantic proportions is incoming. Instructions from Public Safety officials are: Do not sweep any chimneys during the storm. Accidents may occur if this warning is not heeded.
column4: Ein Sturm von gigantischem Ausmaß wird erwartet. Offizielle der öffentlichen Sicherheit raten: Reinigt keine Kamine während des Sturms, andernfalls drohen Unfälle.

column2: Trade Summit
Current European and International Tariffs as well as protectionist practices will be discussed next Thursday in $OURCAPITAL$.
column4: Aktuelle europäische und internationale Zölle und Schutzmaßnahmen werden nächsten Donnerstag in $OURCAPITAL$ diskutiert.

column2: Postal Convention
Today $OURCOUNTRY_ADJ$ and foreign authorities are assembled to discuss postage fees for all letters sent overseas.
column4: $OURCOUNTRY_ADJ$ und ausländische Offizielle diskutieren heute Postgebühren für Überseebriefe.

column2: Modern Coal Trade
The free trade of coal for railway locomotives and eventually seafaring ships in the western world is being discussed today at the local Chamber of Commerce.
column4: Die Handelskammer diskutiert heute über den freien Kohlehandel für Lokomotiven und Schifffahrt in der westlichen Welt.

column2: Man with unnatural skin tone studied
A man with alarmingly orange skin has recently been the subject of study at a local university. His unnatural skin coloration may have impacted his mental health.
General's funeral.
A former general and banker who died at his house last week to be buried today. Only his intimate friends will be present at the ceremony.
column4: Ein Ii seinem Haus verstorbener, früherer General und Banker wird heute im engsten Freundeskreis beerdigt.

column2: Mountain top birth
A woman who fell ill during ascension to the mountain top was taken by her two companions to a shelter 4000 feet above sea level to give birth to a healthy boy.
column4: Während Bergaufstiegs erkrankte Frau wird von zwei Begleitern zu Schutzhütte auf 4000 Metern gebracht und bringt gesunden Jungen zur Welt.

column2: Moral expansion?
Can we allow history to record that we crushed foreign peoples' dreams of freedom by subjugating them to our government? Can we govern them without their consent?
column4: Ist es rechtens, den Traum nach Freiheit ausländischer Völker von unserer Regierung zu unterdrücken und sie ohne ihre Zustimmung zu regieren?

column2: Blackmailer arrested.
A former actor and an alleged deserter from the army was today jailed for annoying a famous actress with requests for money.
column4: Ehemaliger Schauspieler und mutmaßl. Deserteur der Armee heute verhaftet wegen Geldforderungen an bekannter Schauspielerin.

column2: Skirting evil
Fashion cannot dictate the dust of the sidewalks to be dragged into homes, a physician claims, and demands women abandon the new trend of wearing trailing skirts for health reasons.
Faith cure kills child
A 12 yearsold girl sick with dysentery died at a local hospital after parents replaced the family physician with a faith doctor.
column4: 12 Jahre altes Mädchen stirbt in Krankenhaus, nachdem Eltern den Familienarzt durch Prediger ersetzen.

column2: Respect of Yardies gained!
A local man from $ANYPROVINCE$ reports having beat down many men armed with rifles in a local pub. The man claimd the assailants put themselves at a disadvantage by using weapons.
column4: Einwohner von $ANYPROVINCE$ schlägt mit Gewehren bewaffnete Männer in Bar. Er behauptet, die Waffen waren ihr Nachteil.

column2: Article review
All newspaper articles to be subjected to a review by a special board to confirm their accuracy and truthfulness. In unrelated news: The journalist writing about wooden pavements has vanished.
column4: Alle Nachrichten werden von einem speziellen Team auf Genauigkeit und Wahrheit geprüft. Davon unabhängig: Journalist, der von hölzernem Straßenbelag berichtete, wird vermisst.

column2: Law discussed
Lawyers from all over the country convened today in $OURCAPITAL$ to discuss eventual updates to the country's judiciary system in matters of civil and criminal law.
column4: Anwälte aus gesamtem Land trafen sich heute in $OURCAPITAL$, um mögliche Gesetzesaktualisierungen im zivilen und Straf-Recht zu diskutieren.

column2: The history of $OURCOUNTRY$
A definitive multivolume work on the history of the $OURCOUNTRY_ADJ$ civilization has finally been completed. Leading historians proclaim it the greatest reference yet, true to our heroic deeds.
column4: Ein mehrere Bänder umfassendes Werk zur Geschichte der $OURCOUNTRY_ADJ$ Zivilisation wurde fertiggestellt. Führende Historiker nennen es die beste Referenz all unserer heroischen Taten.

column2: Cithara Concert

A dash of nostalgia for all enthusiasts of music. A collection of Cobelius' most famous cithara pieces will be played by the $OURCOUNTRY_ADJ$ National Orchestra next week in the Grand Concert Hall of $OURCAPITAL$.
Stone delivered
Inhabitants of $ANYPROVINCE$ puzzled by the delivery of gigantic pieces of marble from abroad. Rumour has it that a new grandiose monument will be built in the capital's main square.
column4: Einwohner von $ANYPROVINCE$ beeindruckt von einer Lieferung gigantischer Marmorblöcke von Übersee. Gerüchten zufolge wird ein neues, grandioses Monument auf dem Marktplatz der Hauptstadt errichtet.

column2: Mechanical contraptions
Gadgets of various sorts will play an increasingly large part in everyday life, according to a top boffin who heads the engineering department at $OURCAPITAL$ university.
column4: Wichtiger Wissenschaftler der Ingenieurs-Abteilung der Universität von $OURCAPITAL$ sieht verschiedene Neuheiten von großer Bedeutung für den Alltag.

column2: Blacksmith dead
A blacksmith was kicked to death by a horse he was attempting to shoe in $ANYPROVINCE$ yesterday.
column4: Schmied bei Hufanpassungen von Pferd in $ANYPROVINCE$ gestern zu Tode getreten.

column2: Solar eclipse
Readers are politely reminded that a solar eclipse is due to occur this coming Friday. The temporary phenomenon is no cause for panic or work stoppages.
column4: Kommenden Freitag wird eine Sonnenfinsternis erwartet. Das Phänomen ist kein Grund zu Panik oder Arbeitsausfällen.

column2: Monocle sales plateau
Monocle sales, which have been rising for decades, appear to have levelled out. Orders have held steady through the last quarter.
column4: In den letzten Jahrzehnten stetig wachsende Monokel-Käufe scheinbar stabilisiert. Aufträge im letzten Quartal konstant.

column2: Time travel
A prominent author of penny dreadfuls has put forth the idea that man could move backwards and forwards through time, appearing at various dates in the past and present.
column4: Berühmter Groschenroman-Autor entwickelt Idee, das Menschen in der Zeit vor und zurück reisen und zu verschiedenen Zeiten in Vergangenheit und Zukunft erscheinen können.

column2: Literacy
Literacy is at an all-time high across the globe, new figures show. Previously the preserve of the clergy and noble classes, it is now seen even amongst the common labourer and fairer sex.
column4: Neue Höchstwerte weltweit erreicht. Bildung nicht länger Privileg des Klerus und Adels, auch  ungelernte Arbeiter und das schöne Geschlecht nehmen teil.

column2: Public ‘science’ lecture
Aspiring natural philosophers are advised that a lecture on geology, or the study of rock formations, will take place in the $OURCAPITAL$ auditorium on Tuesday next. Admission is £1.
column4: Freunde der Naturphilosophie wird interessieren, dass nächsten Dienstag ein Vortrag zu Felsformationen und Geologie im Auditorium von $OURCAPITAL$ zum Eintrittspreis von  ¤1 stattfindet.

column2: Meeting interrupted
A political club was invaded by campaigners for equality of the sexes yesterday. The womens' husbands have been reprimanded by the constabulary for neglecting to control their wives.
column4: Ein politischer Club wurde gestern von Aktivisten zur Gleichstellung der Geschlechter überrannt. Die Ehemänner wurden für die mangelnde Kontrolle ihrer Frauen von der Gendarmerie gemaßregelt.

column2: The Gothic Man
The Gothic maintains a dignified demeanor, has a strong sense of fair play and is an advocate of liberty. Inventive, graceful and witty, he cuts a striking figure amongst the nationalities.
Wave of Influenza
Flu sweeps $OURCOUNTRY$. There are already many reported infections throughout the land. Laymen fear a pandemic might be coming, while experts assure it's just a seasonal occurrence.
column4: Die Grippe beutelt $OURCOUNTRY$. Infektionen breiten sich aus. Laien fürchten eine Pandemie, Experten werten die Situation als saisonale Begebenheit.

column2: Hoarde uncovered
The remnants of an old coin hoard were found in $ANYPROVINCE$ this week. Authorities mention many pieces of golden coinage discovered by a farmer plowing a field after heavy rain.
column4: Die Reste eines alten Goldschatzes wurden diese Woche in $ANYPROVINCE$ entdeckt. Offizielle melden Unmenge an Goldmünzen, die von Bauern in der Feldarbeit im Regen ausgegraben wurden.

column2: Metric Nonsense
According to a Gothic statesman, the Imperial System is the way of the future: 'This Britannian Metric nonsense is bound to never catch on' he claims.

The combination of renewed interest in Ancient Greek civilization and the idea of sport as an important part of social development has led a Frankish aristocrat, Baron Paul van Colbert, to propose reviving the Olympic Games as a way to promote international peace through friendly athletic competition between nations. The largest sporting event to date, the first Olympic Games hosts participants who competed in nine disciplines, including wrestling, weightlifting, fencing and cycling. Winners in each discipline receive a silver medal, an olive branch and a diploma.

The combination of renewed interest in Ancient Greek civilization and the idea of sport as an important part of social development has led a Frankish aristocrat, Baron Paul van Colbert, to propose reviving the Olympic Games to promote international peace through athletic competition.
The renewed interest in Ancient Greek civilization and the idea of sport as a part of social development has led a Frankish aristocrat, Baron Paul van Colbert, to revive the Olympic Games.
